intro: Caldcluvia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan caldcluvia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. Caldcluvia papuana is often found growing in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
